“It’s all a mirage,” Raskolnikov said, frustration boiling. 

“Stop! It’s insulting!” Razumihin replied. 

“I noticed their insinuations long ago,” Raskolnikov continued. 

“Why dare they? What foundation have they?” 

Raskolnikov paced, his anger rising. 

“Just a poor student, unhinged by poverty,” he muttered. 

“Facing insolent policemen and debts, all on an empty stomach.” 

He clenched his fists. 

“Damn them! I’d laugh or spit in their faces!” 

Razumihin shook his head, eyes wide. 

“Rodya, don’t let them get to you.” 

“I can’t help it,” Raskolnikov snapped. 

“They push me to the edge.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov expresses his frustration and anger towards the police's insinuations about him, feeling insulted by their lack of evidence and understanding of his circumstances.
